event.title: was annexed to the city of Haverhill in 1897

data.event: The village, located on the south side of the Merrimack River, was annexed to the city of Haverhill in 1897.

event.title: was changed to Bradford at a town meeting held January 7, 1672

data.event: Bradford was originally part of the town of Rowley, and was called "Rowley on the Merrimack", "Rowley Village by the Merrimack", "Merrimac Lands", or just "Merrimack" before the name was changed to Bradford at a town meeting held January 7, 1672.
It was named in memory of Bradford in the West Riding of Yorkshire, England, from which some of the settlers had emigrated, and first paid colonial tax on October 13, 1675.
The east parish of Bradford (established in 1726) separated in 1850 and was incorporated as the town of Groveland on March 8, 1850.
The east parish of Bradford (established in 1726) separated in 1850 and was incorporated as the town of Groveland on March 8, 1850.

event.title: was incorporated as the town of Groveland on March 8, 1850

data.event: The east parish of Bradford (established in 1726) separated in 1850 and was incorporated as the town of Groveland on March 8, 1850.

event.title: was annexed to the city of Haverhill in 1897

data.event: The remaining west part of Bradford was annexed to the city of Haverhill in 1897.
This first church was replaced in 1705.

event.title: 1726 the east parish of Bradford was established

data.event: In 1726 the east parish of Bradford was established which later in 1850 became the town of Groveland.
In 1726 the east parish of Bradford was established which later in 1850 became the town of Groveland.
In 1751 the church was replaced by a new building that was located on what is now Bradford common.

data.event: In 1751 the church was replaced by a new building that was located on what is now Bradford common.

event.title: 1848 the fifth Bradford church was built

data.event: In 1848 the fifth Bradford church was built at is present location facing the common.
